results.title: Understanding Cancer Pt.3
results.brief_description: This program is the final part of a three part documentary that looks at cancer. The program concentrates on the three main types of treatment that are offered to cancer patients - surgery, chemotherapy, and radiotherapy. Specialists in these fields discuss the treatments and when it is appropriate to use them.

results.title: Understanding Cancer Pt.2
results.brief_description: This program is the second part of a three part documentary that looks at cancer. Presented by Professor Richard Fox of the Ludwig Institute of Cancer Research, this program focuses on the disease from the patient’s point of view. The patients who appear in this documentary discuss their experiences with treatment and talk about their physical and emotional reactions.

results.title: Understanding Cancer Pt.1
results.brief_description: This program is the first of a three part documentary that looks at cancer. Presented by Professor Richard Fox, from the Ludwig Institute for Cancer Research, this program examines issues such as, what is cancer? and what causes cancer? Cancer specialists discuss these issues and comment on the influences of factors such as diet, environment and genetics.

results.title: Understanding cancer (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Jim Dale, Roger Hudson and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description: By considering two basic questions, what is cancer? and what is the cause of cancer?, this program attempts to lay at rest many of the myths about this disease. A very comprehensive coverage of the nature of cancer, epidemiology and carcinogens. Presented by Professor Richard Fox, Ludwig Institute for Cancer Research, University of Sydney.

results.title: Understanding Auslan
results.brief_description: This video is an instructional and entertaining look at the different types of sign language which exist around the world. It explains the development of Auslan - Australian Sign Language - in Australia, why there are variations in signing between states and countries and generations, the grammatical differences between Auslan and English, and a basic introduction to Auslan. The video is presented with a voiceover and subtitles for the hearing impaired.

results.title: Understanding alcohol: use and abuse
results.creator_credit: Tad Stones and Walt Disney Educational Media Company
results.brief_description: Discusses the physical, mental and social effects of alcohol and describes the four stages of inebriation. Examines the various factors which may lead to the use and abuse of alcohol. Narrated by Ralph Story.

results.title: Understanding aggro/hooliganism
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Social Psychology”.
Research into the origins and forms of soccer hooliganism. It is a vehicle for the younger generation to find excitement, including ritualised violence. Presented by Dr George Gaskell.

results.title: Understanding aggression
results.creator_credit: Ronald H. Riley, R.H.R. Productions and Margaret Thomson
results.brief_description: Intended for teaching psychiatric nursing, this is a study of aggression, a normal reaction which the well-balanced person learns to control but which presents a difficult problem in the psychiatric hospital.

results.title: Understanding A.D.D.: Attention Deficit Disorder
results.creator_credit: Australian Video Publishers and Bryan Lowe
results.brief_description: Dr. Christopher Green, author of the famous “Toddler taming” and “Babies”, is a leading authority on Attention Deficit Disorder. This program, designed for parents, teachers and healthcare professionals, investigates key issues about the disorder. It profiles the causes of ADD, behaviours associated with the condition, diagnosis, treatment, medication, adult manifestations of the condition and includes a segment with questions from the audience.

results.title: Understanding
results.creator_credit: Peter Montagnon, Alasdair Clayre, Patrick Lui and Nigel Houghton
results.brief_description:
Episode number 9 of Series “Heart of the Dragon”.
This program is Part Nine of a twelve episode documentary, The Heart of the Dragon. The documentary records what is actually happening in China today and it captures on film the lives of peasants, factory workers, Party officials, artists, scientists, and even millionaires.
